SEARCH
Package edu.carroll.initMusic.jpa.model

Class Playlist

java.lang.Object
edu.carroll.initMusic.jpa.model.Playlist
@Entity public class Playlist extends Object
This class is used to represent Playlist objects, and maps to our database table. A playlist is a collection of songs created by a user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Playlist()
    JPA needs this constructor to instantiate entities when retrieving data from the database.
    Playlist(User author, String playlistName)
    Creates new playlist instance
    Playlist(String playlistName)
    Creates a new Playlist instance Only parameter is playlistName, because when a new playlist is made, there will be no songs in it, so no song parameters are needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Playlist

      public Playlist()
      JPA needs this constructor to instantiate entities when retrieving data from the database. Its protected so it can't be used to create new Album objects by other classes.

    • Playlist

      public Playlist(User author, String playlistName)
      Creates new playlist instance
      Parameters:
      author - Author of playlist
      playlistName - Name of playlist

    • Playlist

      public Playlist(String playlistName)
      Creates a new Playlist instance Only parameter is playlistName, because when a new playlist is made, there will be no songs in it, so no song parameters are needed.
      Parameters:
      playlistName - Name of playlist
